title: Retracing the Pure Past: A Magnificent Picture of Marine Ecology

content.text: Long tims ago, when human intervention in the marine environment was relatively limited, the ocean was a pure and mysterious world. Through the crystal clear waters, we were able to glimpse fascinating underwater landscapes, as if we were in a boundless, jewel-like blue sea.

In the oceans of that era, vibrant marine life formed a spectacular ecosystem. Colourful coral reefs acted as underwater gardens, attracting a variety of fish and other marine life. Schools of fish danced among the reefs, creating picturesque images. Tuna, sailfish and sharks move freely through the ocean, displaying their unique strength and grace.

Dolphins and whales are the guardians and travellers of the ocean. They swim in the vast seas and are known for their friendly and intelligent image. We have been able to witness them leaping out of the water and dancing in the company of the sea breeze, a mesmerising sight that leaves a wonderful and lasting impression.

Sea turtles, the ancient wise men of the sea, search for food at the bottom of the ocean and swim leisurely in the azure waters. Their presence is always a source of respect, as they symbolise resilience and vitality.The birds of the sea also form a magnificent sight. Flying gulls soar freely through the air; they are the bridge between the sea and the land.
Gulls, albatrosses and penguins are an integral part of the marine ecosystem, bringing us endless surprises and joy as they search for food and shelter in the ocean.
